summary: Mesothelioma is a type of cancer that develops from the mesothelium, the thin layer of tissue lining internal organs. It most commonly affects the lining of the lungs and chest wall, but can also occur in the lining of the abdomen, heart sac, or testis sac. The disease is strongly linked to asbestos exposure, with symptoms often appearing decades after exposure.
causes: Irradiation of the chest or abdomen
risk_factors: Occupational exposure to asbestos (mining, production, working with asbestos products)
Living near naturally occurring asbestos deposits
Exposure to talc (near mines or mills)
Paraoccupational secondary exposure (family members of asbestos workers)
symptoms: Swelling of the neck or face
Cardiac symptoms (constrictive pericarditis, heart failure, pulmonary embolism, cardiac tamponade)
Blood clots in arteries of the lungs (pulmonary embolism)
treatments: Chemotherapy (cisplatin, pemetrexed, raltitrexed, gemcitabine, vinorelbine, carboplatin, adriamycin)
Multimodality therapy (combination of surgery, radiation, chemotherapy)
